derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hōc, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hoek 'corner, angle, projecting piece of land', also to German Haken 'hook'

encyclopedia.content: 科学家胡克 (Robert Hooke， 1635-1703) 胡克(Robert Hooke， 1635-1703) 英国物理学家、天文学家。1635年7月18日生于威特岛的弗雷施瓦特。其父是教区牧师。1653年入牛津基督教会学院后胡克结识了玻意耳。1655年胡克成为玻意耳的助手。1662年起直到逝世一直担任皇家学会实验管理员。1663年胡克获得了牛津大学文学学士学位，并且被选为皇家学会会员。1665年胡克任格雷山姆学院几何学、地质学教授，并从事天文观测工作。1666年伦敦

entry.def: A hook is a bent piece of metal or plastic that is used for catching or holding things, or for hanging things up.

example.ex: One of his jackets hung from a hook.
example.tran: 他的一件夹克衫挂在衣钩上。

entry.def: If you hook one thing to another, you attach it there using a hook. If something hooks somewhere, it can be hooked there.

example.ex: Paul hooked his tractor to the car and pulled it to safety.
example.tran: 保罗把自己的拖拉机挂在汽车上，然后把它拉到了安全的地方。

example.ex: ...one of those can openers that hooked onto the wall.
example.tran: 那些挂在墙上的开罐器中的一个

entry.def: If you hook your arm, leg, or foot round an object, you place it like a hook round the object in order to move it or hold it.

example.ex: She latched on to his arm, hooking her other arm around a tree...
example.tran: 她拽住他的胳膊不放，另一只胳膊抱紧一棵树。

example.ex: I hooked my left arm over the side of the dinghy.
example.tran: 我用左臂钩住小划艇的船舷。

entry.def: If you hook a fish, you catch it with a hook on the end of a line.

example.ex: At the first cast I hooked a huge fish.
example.tran: 第一次抛下钓线，我就钓了一条大鱼。

entry.def: A hook is a short sharp blow with your fist that you make with your elbow bent, usually in a boxing match.

example.ex: Lewis desperately needs to keep clear of Ruddock's big left hook.
example.tran: 刘易斯无论如何得躲开拉多克凌厉的左钩拳才行。

entry.def: If you are hooked into something, or hook into something, you get involved with it.

example.ex: I'm guessing again now because I'm not hooked into the political circles...
example.tran: 我现在又是在猜测了，因为我没有涉足政界。

example.ex: Eager to hook into a career but can't find one right for you?
example.tran: 急于干一番事业，但又找不到适合自己的？

entry.def: If you hook into the Internet, you make a connection with the Internet on a particular occasion so that you can use it.

example.ex: ...an interactive media tent where people will be able to hook into the internet.
example.tran: 人们可以上网的互动式媒体帐篷区

entry.def: If someone gets off the hook or is let off the hook, they manage to get out of the awkward or unpleasant situation that they are in.

example.ex: Government officials accused of bribery and corruption get off the hook with monotonous regularity...
example.tran: 被指控贪污受贿的政府官员无一例外总能脱身。

example.ex: His opponents have no intention of letting him off the hook until he agrees to leave office immediately.
example.tran: 在他同意马上离职之前，他的对手不打算放过他。

entry.def: If you take a phone off the hook, you take the receiver off the part that it normally rests on, so that the phone will not ring.
If your phone is ringing off the hook, so many people are trying to telephone you that it is ringing constantly.

example.ex: Since war broke out, the phones at donation centers have been ringing off the hook.
example.tran: 自从战争爆发以来，捐赠中心的电话就一直响个不停。

means.word_mean: 1. a catch for locking a door
2. a sharp curve or crook; a shape resembling a hook
3. anything that serves as an enticement
4. a mechanical device that is curved or bent to suspend or hold or pull something
5. a curved or bent implement for suspending or pulling something
6. a golf shot that curves to the left for a right-handed golfer;

sentences.sentence: "he tooks lessons to cure his hooking"

means.word_mean: 7. a short swinging punch delivered from the side with the elbow bent
8. a basketball shot made over the head with the hand that is farther from the basket
1. fasten with a hook
2. rip off; ask an unreasonable price
3. make a piece of needlework by interlocking and looping thread with a hooked needle;
4. hit a ball and put a spin on it so that it travels to the left
5. take by theft;
6. make off with belongings of others
7. hit with a hook;
8. catch with a hook;
9. to cause (someone or oneself) to become dependent (on something, especially a narcotic drug)
10. secure with the foot;
11. entice and trap;

sentences.sentence: "The car salesman had snared three potential customers"

means.word_mean: 12. approach with an offer of sexual favors;

sentences.sentence: "The young man was caught soliciting in the park"

list.explanation: 包庇某人，为某人开脱责任

example.en: He falls for Uona and winds up trying to get her off the hook.
example.zh: 他爱上了伊洛娜，最后竟想包庇她过关。

example.en: His air hook is stopped up with a cold.
example.zh: 他因感冒而鼻子不通了。

Sentence.sentence: Apple stands to win as well, hooking more young consumers with decades of technology purchases ahead of them.
But if it is enacted, Google will in effect be off the hook as far as copyright violations in the US are concerned.
